message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a Danish teacher. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements about AI in education.

Let me think about reasonable responses from a Danish teacher's perspective. I should consider:
1. Positive aspects of AI in education (statements A-E)
2. Negative/risk aspects of AI in education (statements F-J)

As a Danish teacher, I should consider both opportunities and risks:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps write/improve lesson plans - This is generally true and many teachers find this helpful. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI enables adapting material to different abilities - This is a real capability that AI has. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assists in individual student support - This is possible but may have limitations. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - This is a real use case. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps automate admin tasks - This is definitely true. I'll say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent work - This is a real risk. I'll say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35G]: AI makes inappropriate/incorrect recommendations - This is a real concern. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases - This is a documented risk. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardizes privacy and security - This is a real concern. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This could happen. I'll say "Disagree" or "Agree". Let me say "Agree"

These seem like balanced responses that acknowledge both benefits and risks from a teacher's perspective.
